condition.description:
If you have diabetes, your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. Over time, this can damage the covering on your nerves or the blood vessels that bring oxygen to your nerves. Damaged nerves may stop sending messages, or may send messages slowly or at the wrong times.

This damage is called diabetic neuropathy. Over half of people with diabetes get it. Symptoms may include

  • Numbness in your hands, legs, or feet
  • Shooting pains, burning, or tingling
  • Nausea, vomiting, constipation, or diarrhea
  • Problems with sexual function
  • Urinary problems
  • Dizziness when you change positions quickly

Your doctor will diagnose diabetic neuropathy with a physical exam and nerve tests. Controlling your blood sugar can help prevent nerve problems, or keep them from getting worse. Treatment may include pain relief and other medicines.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Diabetic neuropathy (nerve damage)

basics.benefits_moa: Cymbalta is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Cymbalta is good for treating depression and anxiety, and may help with chronic pain. More likely than other antidepressants to cause problems if you drink or have high blood pressure.
downsides: Not a good option if you're a heavy drinker, or if you have liver or kidney problems.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Like most antidepressants, can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

basics.benefits_moa: Lyrica is a nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Lyrica works well as an add-on medicine for seizures and fibromyalgia, but it's especially effective for nerve-related pain after shingles. Not available as a generic, so it might be expensive.
downsides: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Lyrica can cause seizures.
Lyrica is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.

Has a higher risk than other pain medicines of affecting your heart rate or rhythm, so it might not be the best choice if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat).

downsides_processed.orig: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Lyrica can cause seizures.

Has a higher risk than other pain medicines of affecting your heart rate or rhythm, so it might not be the best choice if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat).

upsides: Relieves nerve-related (neuropathic) pain caused by different conditions including diabetes, shingles (herpes zoster), fibromyalgia, and spinal cord damage.
Studies show that lower doses of Lyrica cause fewer side effects and still relieve pain just as well as higher doses.
Also used in combination with other medications to treat epilepsy (partial seizures).

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica impairs your ability to focus, think, react and can cause blurred vision. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Foot and leg swelling
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica may cause swelling in the limbs. It's more common in feet, ankles, or legs, but can occur in the arms. Swelling can be worse if you are taking certain diabetes medications or if you have conditions that make you prone to it. If Lyrica does cause swelling, it should improve when you stop taking the medication, but if it doesn't do away, talk to your about other medication choices.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica may cause swelling in the limbs. It's more common in feet, ankles, or legs, but can occur in the arms. Swelling can be worse if you are taking certain diabetes medications or if you have conditions that make you prone to it. If Lyrica does cause swelling, it should improve when you stop taking the medication, but if it doesn't do away, talk to your about other medication choices.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea.  Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It is safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea.  Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It is safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant because it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about other medication you can take. The same warning applies to men taking Lyrica and possible risk to an unborn baby.
risk_factors: Both male and females taking Lyrica

carousel_items: Take at bedtime to avoid some of its side effects.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, constipation, and weight gain.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Low doses work well to treat certain kinds of chronic pain. It can take 2 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
Low doses of Amitriptyline start working in 45 minutes to help you sleep better.
Six out of every ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Anticholinergic effects
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline blocks acetylcholine, a nervous system chemical involved in many major bodily functions. Therefore, this medication commonly causes symptoms such as dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, dizziness, and higher risk of falls.

carousel_items: Starts working with the first dose, but full effects can take longer.
Remove the protective lining on the patch before applying the patch to unbroken skin.
Leave the patch on for up to 12 hours during a 24 hour period.
You can cut the patches to create a custom fit for the area of skin you need to apply it to.
Don't place any tight wraps or heating pads over the patch while it's on.
Make sure not to touch your eyes after touching the patch. Always wash your hands after putting it on or taking it off.

basics.benefits_moa: Lidocaine is a local anesthetic. It absorbs into your skin where it targets damaged nerves and relieves burning pain.
basics.bottom_line: Lidocaine patches work well by releasing a local anesthetic into the skin and relieving pain by targeting damaged nerves.
downsides: Can cause skin irritation after using it the first time, but for most people it's mild and goes away in a few minutes or hours.
Used patches contain enough medicine to be dangerous to children and pets, so store and dispose of the patches in a safe place out of their reach.
Might not be the best choice if you've had allergic reactions to numbing medications (local anesthetics) in the past.
Even though only small amounts of Lidocaine are absorbed into the body through the skin, if you're taking medications that treat arrhythmias, Lidocaine can affect how they work.
Patches shouldn't be left on for more than 12 hours, used on very large areas of skin, or covered with a heating pad.

upsides: Lidocaine can treat pain better for people who can't take oral pain medications due to allergies or bad side effects.
Has been shown to relieve nerve pain due to shingles for up to 12 hours at a time.
Patches can be cut into smaller pieces to best fit the areas of skin they need to be used on.

drugs.name: Lidocaine

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working with the first dose, but full effects can take longer.
Remove the protective lining on the patch before applying the patch to unbroken skin.
Leave the patch on for up to 12 hours during a 24 hour period.
You can cut the patches to create a custom fit for the area of skin you need to apply it to.
Don't place any tight wraps or heating pads over the patch while it's on.
Make sure not to touch your eyes after touching the patch. Always wash your hands after putting it on or taking it off.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: Lidocaine can build up in the body if too much is absorbed or if the drug can't be removed correctly. Symptoms include irregular heartbeat, slowed breathing, seizures and if serious can lead to death. Do not leave Lidocaine on skin longer than 12 hours, use on very large areas, or cover with a tight wrap or heating pad, all can increase the total amount of medication in the body and cause an overdose. Older more frail patients might be more sensitive. Lidocaine is removed from the body by the liver so if you have liver disease talk to your doctor about possible changes in your dose.
risk_factors: Use of heating pad on skin
Applying patch to red, irritated or broken skin
Leaving patch on for more than 12 hours
Using patch on a very large area
Older age and lower body weight

description_processed.orig: Lidocaine can build up in the body if too much is absorbed or if the drug can't be removed correctly. Symptoms include irregular heartbeat, slowed breathing, seizures and if serious can lead to death. Do not leave Lidocaine on skin longer than 12 hours, use on very large areas, or cover with a tight wrap or heating pad, all can increase the total amount of medication in the body and cause an overdose. Older more frail patients might be more sensitive. Lidocaine is removed from the body by the liver so if you have liver disease talk to your doctor about possible changes in your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you've had an allergic reaction to numbing medications (local anesthetics) in the past. You could also be allergic to Lidocaine and want to be careful using it for the first time. Rarely, Lidocaine can cause serious allergic reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Call 911 or your doctor if you develop any of these symptoms while taking Lidocaine.

Call 911 or your doctor if you develop any of these symptoms while taking Lidocaine.

risks_warnings.title: Accidental poisoning
risks_warnings.description: Store Lidocaine away from children and pets. Used patches have enough medication to cause serious illness if chewed or swallowed. Remove any used patch by folding onto itself so the medication is on the inside. Call 911 or your doctor or vet right away if you suspect a child or pet has found and chewed or eaten Lidocaine.
risk_factors: Children and pets can reach medication

risks_warnings.title: Eye irritation
risks_warnings.description: Wash your hands right away after you apply Lidocaine to your skin especially if you touch your eye(s). It can be very painful so flush your eye(s) completely with water or a saline rinse eye wash. If eye pain or numbness continues make sure you tell your doctor and have it checked right away.
risk_factors: Not washing hands after touching or applying Lidocaine

description_processed.orig: Wash your hands right away after you apply Lidocaine to your skin especially if you touch your eye(s). It can be very painful so flush your eye(s) completely with water or a saline rinse eye wash. If eye pain or numbness continues make sure you tell your doctor and have it checked right away.

risks_warnings.title: Skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Lidocaine can cause skin irritation including redness, rash, discoloration, bruising and blistering after using it for the first time. Most people report the skin irritation is mild and goes away in a few minutes or a few hours after applying the patch. If you notice more serious redness, burning, or blistering, remove Lidocaine and call your doctor.
risk_factors: Covering patch with wrap or heating pad

description_processed.orig: Lidocaine can cause skin irritation including redness, rash, discoloration, bruising and blistering after using it for the first time. Most people report the skin irritation is mild and goes away in a few minutes or a few hours after applying the patch. If you notice more serious redness, burning, or blistering, remove Lidocaine and call your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Although Lidocaine used on the skin has less absorption in the body than if it was taken by mouth, there is still a certain amount that gets into the body. In people who have heart problems, especially irregular heartbeat, Lidocaine can work in a similar way as some medication used to treat the condition. Because of this, Lidocaine can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat especially if you are taking other medication to treat your heart condition. Tell your doctor about your heart condition before you start taking Lidocaine.
risk_factors: Using Lidocaine with drugs to treat irregular heartbeat

carousel_items: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

clock.tip: Works faster and stronger when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Gabapentin is an antiepileptic and nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Gabapentin is an old seizure disorder medicine that's now used to treat nerve-related pain caused by different conditions.
downsides: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

downsides_processed.orig: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

upsides: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

drugs.name: Neurontin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Neurologic and psychiatric side effects (children)
risks_warnings.description: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

description_processed.orig: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

risks_warnings.title: Serious rash and multiple organ problems
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Can cause tingling skin sensations and reduced appetite.
Report any confusion, decreased sweating, fever, or changes in behavior or vision.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

clock.tip: Works slower when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Topamax is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to affect multiple parts of the brain to control seizures and migraines.
basics.bottom_line: Topamax is useful for preventing seizures and migraines, and doesn't require blood tests while you're on it.
downsides: Can cause sleepiness, speech problems, tingling sensations, and weight loss.
A few people will get kidney stones.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause sleepiness, speech problems, tingling sensations, and weight loss.
A few people will get kidney stones.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Used on its own or with other antiepileptic medicines to lower the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic or partial seizures, or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.
Doesn't need routine blood tests.

upsides_processed.orig: Used on its own or with other antiepileptic medicines to lower the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic or partial seizures, or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.

Still get migraines but they're tolerable headaches usually and don't even require pain meds. Tingling subsided after a couple of months. Minor brain fog worth the migraine abatement. Don't mind the weight loss either.

Definitely reduced my appetite, but for me it's absolutely worth it for the almost perfect migraine prevention.
I take it for MS-associated nerve pain, not diabetes, but the option wasn't there. Be careful about dosage, especially if you're taking with other meds that make you sleepy.

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Can cause tingling skin sensations and reduced appetite.
Report any confusion, decreased sweating, fever, or changes in behavior or vision.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Uncontrolled body temperature
risks_warnings.description: Topamax can cause high body temperature and decreased sweating. Monitor your body temperature during strenuous exercise or exposure to high outside temperatures.

description_processed.orig: Topamax can cause high body temperature and decreased sweating. Monitor your body temperature during strenuous exercise or exposure to high outside temperatures.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to high ammonia
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may increase your risk for kidney stones. Stay well-hydrated to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may increase your risk for kidney stones. Stay well-hydrated to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Vision problems
risks_warnings.description: Topamax can cause eye pain, blurry vision, or narrow vision. Vision problems can happen any time while taking this medication. Tell your doctor if you have any changes in your vision.

description_processed.orig: Topamax can cause eye pain, blurry vision, or narrow vision. Vision problems can happen any time while taking this medication. Tell your doctor if you have any changes in your vision.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Topamax suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Topamax, talk to your doctor before making any changes. Its safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Topamax suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Topamax, talk to your doctor before making any changes. Its safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

carousel_items: Short-acting insulin good for blood sugar control around meal times.
Take 5 to 10 minutes before a meal. Effects last for 2-4 hours.
Can cause weight gain and low blood sugar.
Make sure you and your family know the symptoms of low blood sugar: sweating, shakiness, weakness, fast heartbeat, nervousness, headache, blurry vision, trouble thinking clearly, or passing out.
Always have a good source of sugar nearby for low blood sugar episodes.
Make sure you understand how to give yourself the injections.
When mixing with another insulin (such as insulin NPH), draw this insulin into the syringe first.
Don't shake the vial. Store unopened vials in the refrigerator. Opened vials are good at room temperature for 28 days.
Check your blood sugar levels every day.

basics.benefits_moa: Humalog is a short-acting insulin medicine for diabetes. It acts like the insulin that your body normally makes to process sugars and fats, and it keeps your blood sugar stable after meals.
basics.bottom_line: Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides meal-time sugar control. It can cause low blood sugar, so make sure you know what the symptoms are and always have a source of sugar nearby.
downsides: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar multiple times every day, usually before each meal.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar multiple times every day, usually before each meal.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

upsides: Insulin is the most effective blood sugar-lowering medicine. When used correctly, it'll lower blood sugar every time you use it and prevent the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides sugar control after meals.
Dose can be easily adjusted to make a customized regimen that's tailored to your body.
Starting insulin early in the treatment of Type 2 diabetes can maintain your body's insulin-producing cells and slow down disease progression.
Okay to use even if you have liver or kidney problems, unlike most other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatening low blood sugar (Hypoglycemia)
risks_warnings.description: Very low blood sugar is life-threatening. Understand how your body signals low blood sugar, which may include fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, feeling shaky, confusion or irritability. Make sure you have access to easy sugar sources to treat low blood sugar.
risk_factors: Use of other blood sugar lowering medicines

description_processed.orig: Very low blood sugar is life-threatening. Understand how your body signals low blood sugar, which may include fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, feeling shaky, confusion or irritability. Make sure you have access to easy sugar sources to treat low blood sugar.

risks_warnings.title: Complications due to low potassium
risks_warnings.description: Humalog can decrease the amount of potassium that is available to be used in your body. Unmanaged low potassium can cause heart problems, trouble breathing or death.
risk_factors: Use of other medicine that lowers potassium

description_processed.orig: Humalog can decrease the amount of potassium that is available to be used in your body. Unmanaged low potassium can cause heart problems, trouble breathing or death.

risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility for severe and life-threatening allergy to Humalog. Stop use and seek immediate medical attention for any signs of trouble breathing or rash.

Check your blood sugar levels every day.

basics.bottom_line: Levemir is a long-acting insulin that provides all-day sugar control. It can cause low blood sugar, so make sure you know what the symptoms are and always have a source of sugar nearby.
downsides: You have to take insulin by injection.

Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.
